## Text to Speech with high quality, human-like AI voice generator

## Emotionally & contextually aware AI voices for Text to Speech
Our voice AI responds to emotional cues in text and adapts its delivery to suit both the immediate content and the wider context. This lets our AI voices achieve high emotional range and avoid making logical errors when your content is read aloud.
[Get Started with Free Text to Speech](https://elevenlabs.io/app/sign-up)
## Infinite selection of AI voices
Find the perfect voice for your content. Choose from thousands of voices in Voice Library or use Voice Design to create new AI voices from scratch. Adjust age, accent, and voice settings to match your production needs
[Explore Voice Library](https://elevenlabs.io/community)
## Listen on the go
Our ElevenReader app narrates articles, PDFs, ePubs, newsletters, or any other text content. Simply choose a voice from our expansive library, upload your content, and listen from your phone as it's read aloud by one of our narrators.
[Get ElevenReader App](https://elevenlabs.io/text-reader)
## Studio quality video voiceovers
Choose a voice, upload your script, and generate high quality voiceovers for social media, commercials, movies, and more. Adjust the timing, assign multiple speakers, and add sound effects in Voiceover studio
[![Voiceover Icon](https://eleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io/payloadcms/b3992zgvmri-VoiceOverIcon.svg)Explore Voiceover Studio](http://elevenlabs.io/voiceover-studio)

# We're building AI to shape the future of communication, ensuring content is understood by everyone, everywhere.
![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2Frx0rhct1k9m-2zkr3rb1oha-about.jpg&w=3840&q=95)
Weâ€™re backed by leading names
ElevenLabs is an AI audio research and deployment company. Our mission is to make content universally accessible in any language and in any voice.  
Our research team develops AI audio models that generate realistic, versatile and contextually-aware speech, voices, and sound effects across 32 languages. Our product team tailors these models to the needs of everyday users, prosumers, and businesses.  
Our technology is used to voice audiobooks and news articles, animate video game characters, help in film pre-production, localize media in entertainment, create dynamic audio content for social media and advertising, and train medical professionals. It has also given back voices to those who have lost them and helped individuals with accessibility needs in their daily lives.  
We develop our tools mindful of their impact. AI voices offer a preview into the future of digital interaction and making them safe is our priority. Our goal is to ensure that our products are developed, deployed and used safely, while continuing to drive positive and creative applications.

Creates Audio Native enabled project, optionally starts conversion and returns project ID and embeddable HTML snippet.
### Headers
xi-api-keystringRequired
### Request
This endpoint expects a multipart form containing an optional file.
namestringRequired
Project name.
imagestringOptional
(Deprecated) Image URL used in the player. If not provided, default image set in the Player settings is used.
authorstringOptional
Author used in the player and inserted at the start of the uploaded article. If not provided, the default author set in the Player settings is used.
titlestringOptional
Title used in the player and inserted at the top of the uploaded article. If not provided, the default title set in the Player settings is used.
smallbooleanOptionalDefaults to `false`
(Deprecated) Whether to use small player or not. If not provided, default value set in the Player settings is used.
text_colorstringOptional
Text color used in the player. If not provided, default text color set in the Player settings is used.
background_colorstringOptional
Background color used in the player. If not provided, default background color set in the Player settings is used.
sessionizationintegerOptionalDefaults to `0`
(Deprecated) Specifies for how many minutes to persist the session across page reloads. If not provided, default sessionization set in the Player settings is used.
voice_idstringOptional
Voice ID used to voice the content. If not provided, default voice ID set in the Player settings is used.
model_idstringOptional
TTS Model ID used in the player. If not provided, default model ID set in the Player settings is used.
filefileOptional
Either txt or HTML input file containing the article content. HTML should be formatted as follows â€˜<html><body><div><p>Your content</p><h5>More of your content</h5><p>Some more of your content</p></div></body></html>â€™
auto_convertbooleanOptionalDefaults to `false`
Whether to auto convert the project to audio or not.
### Response
Successful Response
project_idstring
The ID of the created Audio Native project.
convertingboolean
Whether the project is currently being converted.
html_snippetstring
The HTML snippet to embed the Audio Native player.
### Errors
422
Audio Native Create Request Unprocessable Entity Error

Many transcription models hallucinate when processing multi-language dialogue. Adapt struggled finding tools that could transcribe content that switched from Arabic to Hebrew. Their tools could transcribe the Arabic accurately but when the content switched to Hebrew it would still be transcribed in Arabic, creating unintelligible outputs. ElevenLabs handles these situations better thanks to our multilingual capabilities, thus reducing errors and time spent for review and saving Adapt time, which directly translates to cost savings as well.

# Adjust Voice Settings
Jan 11, 2023 â€¢ 1 minute reading time
![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=%2Fplaceholder-16x9.jpg&w=3840&q=95)![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=%2Fplaceholder-1x1.jpg&w=3840&q=95)
To allow you more control on your voices we are adding Voice Settings as part of Speech Synthesis , where you can control how similar and varied the voice is! 
We are adding 2 settings that will help you control your voices - this has biggest effect on the voices you clone. One is Stability - which allows you decide on variability of the voice - whether you want it to be more stable and similar between regenerations, or more varied, or expressive. The more varied it is, it might result in slight artifacts and with higher stability, the speech will be cleaner. On the other hand you can also adjust the similarity - the more similar it is, the more it will depend on the voice samples you have uploaded. Similarly, if the samples aren't clean it might result in speech artifacts. If prefer for the voice to be more clear, but similar to generic voices then move this slider to the left!

## Adobe Podcast: An Overview
## How Does Adobe Podcast Enhance Work?
With Adobe Podcast Enhance, anybody can enjoy and access audio improvement. Modern artificial intelligence is used to convert your unprocessed recordings into high-quality audio.
Here's how the process works:
### 1. Input and Inspiration
The first easy step in using Adobe Podcast Enhance is to supply your audio input. This could be an interview, a podcast episode, or any other recording that needs work. The tool's purpose is to improve the sound quality by comprehending the subtleties of your audio.
### 2. Voice Isolation and Extraction
The algorithms in Adobe Podcast Enhance then begin working. Their main goal is to separate the voice from undesired sounds and background noise. 
This guarantees that the voice, the primary substance of your recording, is distinct and crystal clear. The voice isolator feature improves listening quality by ensuring that every syllable is heard.
### 3. Audio Enhancement
The AI further refines every aspect of the audio, including clarity and volume levels. Equalization, noise reduction, and other effects are added to ensure the finished product sounds polished and professional. The audio enhancer tool polishes the recording to ensure it matches your original intent.
### 4. Audio Production
Your improved audio will be available when the AI has finished its magic. With Adobe Podcast Enhance, you can be guaranteed that your recordings preserve your work's quality and original intent while also sounding professional.
Converting your recordings to high-quality audio is simple and effective using Adobe Podcast Enhance. All you need to do is upload your audio file, and Adobe's sophisticated AI will take care of the rest, producing polished, high-caliber audio output from your recordings.
## Adobe Podcast Enhance Top Features
Due to its sophisticated features, Adobe Podcast Enhance stands out among audio-enhancing applications. This is what distinguishes it:
### Voice Isolator
Not only does this technology enhance audio quality, but it also accurately separates speech from background noise. Your podcasts and recordings will sound professional since the voice isolator makes sure that the main topic of the recording is audible and clear.
### Superior Audio Clarity
The audio quality of every recording that Adobe Podcast Enhance has upgraded is of a high caliber. Clarity and depth of sound guarantee that your information draws in listeners and holds their interest throughout, making for an enjoyable experience.
### Noise Reduction
Bid farewell to unwelcome background sounds. The noise reduction tool in Adobe Podcast Enhance efficiently eliminates background noise, guaranteeing clear, sharp recordings. This is especially helpful for recordings captured in less-than-perfect conditions.
### Audio Enhancer
The audio enhancer tool improves every aspect of your recording, going beyond noise reduction. It applies effects, equalizes frequencies, and adjusts volume levels to ensure that your audio sounds professional and well-balanced.
### Usability
Adobe Podcast Enhance's design prioritizes ease of use. Regardless of technical skill level, anyone can easily and quickly improve their recordings using its user-friendly interface.
### Flexibility
Adobe Podcast Enhance adjusts to your demands, whether you're improving an interview, podcast, or audio recording. It is an invaluable tool for everyone interested in audio production because of its versatility, demonstrated by its ability to handle various audio types and recording settings.
Adobe Podcast Enhance is essential for podcasters, content creators, and audio professionals since it streamlines converting raw recordings into high-quality audio.
## Pros and Cons of Adobe Podcast Enhance
While Adobe Podcast Enhance is a fantastic AI audio enhancement tool, it does have certain drawbacks. Here are its top pros and cons.
### Pros of Adobe Podcast Enhance
  * Ensures high clarity and richness of sound
  * Effectively isolates voices from background noise
  * Designed for ease of use, making it accessible to users of all technical expertise levels.
  * Suitable for a wide range of audio types and recording conditions.
  * Streamlines the audio enhancement process
### Cons of Adobe Podcast Enhance
  * The final output quality is still somewhat dependent on the initial recording quality.
  * Accessing advanced features may require a subscription.
## Who Can Use Adobe Podcast Enhance?
A broad spectrum of users, from novices to experts, can benefit from audio enhancement using Adobe Podcast Enhance, a flexible tool. Here's how it benefits various user types:
### Future Podcasters
Adobe Podcast Enhance is the ideal partner if you're just starting with podcasting. It makes audio editing easier, allowing you to concentrate on creating content rather than figuring out technical aspects. 
Even if you have no experience with audio editing, you can quickly produce high-quality audio with this program because of its user-friendly interface and automatic capabilities.
### Professional Podcasters
Adobe Podcast Enhance is a tool for experienced podcasters to help them optimize their production processes. 
Its sophisticated capabilities, such as noise reduction and voice isolation, contribute to producing audio that sounds clear and polished. Thanks to this, professionals can save time on editing while maintaining a high degree of audio quality.
### Content Producers
Adobe Podcast Enhance is a great tool for educators, social media influencers, YouTubers, and other content providers. This tool helps enhance audio clarity and quality so that your audience will find your content more engaging and entertaining, whether you're recording voice-overs, tutorials, or interviews.
### Remote Workers
Adobe Podcast Enhance is a useful tool for remote workers who frequently attend virtual meetings and webinars. It may significantly enhance the audio quality of recorded sessions, guaranteeing that crucial information is conveyed efficiently and effectively, irrespective of the recording setting.
## The Future of Audio with Adobe Podcast Enhance
Not only is Adobe Podcast Enhance revolutionizing the audio editing industry now, but it's also setting the stage for audio content production in the future.
With this innovative instrument, the future looks like this:
### Pioneering Audio Enhancement
The platform is constantly changing, utilizing the newest advancements in AI technology to enhance editing and audio quality. As it incorporates more sophisticated capabilities and becomes more widely available, expect its influence on audio creation to increase.
### Expanding Your Creative Horizons
With Adobe Podcast Enhance, creative possibilities will only grow. Look forward to new features that provide more flexibility and customization, enabling users to express their musical style more effectively. This tool will stretch the boundaries of audio editing and improvement.
### Making Audio Editing Universal
Adobe Podcast Enhance aims to enable high-quality audio editing for everyone. Future improvements will make the tool even more user-friendly, guaranteeing that anyone with a passion for audio content creation, podcasting, or both, regardless of technical proficiency, can create high-quality audio. With this tool, you can shape the audio of the future through your imagination and inventiveness.
### Embracing Diversity in Global Audio
The tool aims to include a broader range of cultural influences and audio styles. As a result, users can create and discover audio content that connects with a wide range of international customs. With Adobe Podcast Enhance, producers may combine various sounds and aesthetics to create a more inclusive and diversified audio environment.
## Final Thoughts
Adobe Podcast Enhance changes how we work with audio files by making it simple and affordable for everyone to edit high-quality audio. Producers can swiftly and effectively produce high-quality audio anywhere, from New Delhi to New York. It encourages experimentation with various audio styles and keeps improving, making creating audio pleasant and endless.
Adobe Podcast Enhance is more than a tool; it's a traveling partner for your audio adventures. It removes typical roadblocks, lets you speak in your voice, and converts your thoughts into crystal-clear, high-quality audio. Using this tool, you may realize your audio dreams whether you're a podcaster, instructor, or content developer.

### Challenge
For creators like Nik, one of the main challenges lies in bringing authentic, engaging character voices to life, especially when targeting a global audience. Another is effectively pitching new projects to potential investors and platforms. Creators need a captivating concept and if they plan on targeting an international audience, they should also demonstrate how the final product will resonate across languages and cultures.
### Solutions
To address some of these challenges, Nik has turned to our voice AI tools. [**Voice Design**](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/rvg/) helps in the pitching phase: it lets Nik create bespoke character voices from scratch, selecting their attributes like age, gender or accent. This accelerates development, giving Nik the freedom to experiment and establish a clear direction early on. For the series itself, Nik plans to employ professional voice talent, but Voice Design helps pitch the concept to potential investors who get a better feel for the storyline from the outset.
For localization, Nik plans to use [**AI Dubbing**](https://elevenlabs.io/dubbing)**.** This tool offers automated, end-to-end video localization across 29 languages, significantly reducing the time and cost traditionally involved, all while preserving the original speakersâ€™ voices. It's a game-changer for content creators who want to go global and the tool will soon be expanded into the **Dubbing Studio** workflow, enabling users to dub entire movies, as well as generate and edit their transcripts, translations, and timecodes, thus providing extra control over localization. Weâ€™ve added this additional control precisely with creators like Nik in mind, who arenâ€™t prepared to compromise on quality and authenticity.
### New standard
Our voice AI tools not only help in overcoming the challenges of character voice development and global reach but are also setting new standards in content creation and localization. These tools offer a blend of creativity, efficiency, and market reach, empowering storytellers like Nik to bring their visions to life and set them in a global context.

## **What are traditional IVR systems?**
Interactive voice response (IVR) has been a staple in customer communication for decades. These systems use pre-recorded voice prompts and keypad inputs to route calls. While they help manage high call volumes, they often fail when customers have complex queries or need personalized interactions.
IVR systems have a few common features:
  * Rigid menu structure that forces customers through lengthy options.
  * Limited understanding of customer inputs, often requiring human agents for resolution.
  * High call abandonment rates due to customer frustration and slow responses.
These systems were built for a different eraâ€”one where patience was expected. But todayâ€™s customers demand fast, intuitive service. And outdated IVR just isnâ€™t cutting it anymore. Thatâ€™s why businesses are turning to AI-powered systems for a smarter, smoother customer experience.
## How AI phone systems are transforming customer support
Conversational AI is changing [customer support](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/customer-support-with-conversational-ai-and-text-to-speech) for the better. Unlike traditional IVR, which forces customers through rigid menu structures, AI-powered systems understand natural speech. No more pressing buttons or repeating yourself. Just talk, and the system respondsâ€”like a real conversation.
This is possible thanks to natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. AI doesnâ€™t just recognize wordsâ€”it understands customer intent. It processes complex queries, pulls in relevant customer data, and delivers fast, accurate responses in [natural-sounding speech](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/how-to-generate-natural-sounding-voices-with-text-to-speech-ai). The result? Fewer transfers, quicker resolutions, and a smoother customer experience.
AI-driven call routing takes it a step further. Instead of sending customers down the wrong path, AI phone answering systems analyze past interactions and real-time data to route calls efficiently. No waiting, no frustrationâ€”just instant connections to the right agent or automated solution.
Businesses benefit too. Automating routine inquiries reduces the need for human agents, cutting operational costs while improving response times. AI also gathers valuable data on customer behavior, helping companies fine-tune their support strategies.
With Conversational AI, customer support feels effortless. Itâ€™s faster, smarter, and far more human.

Mar 20, 2025 â€¢ 7 minutes reading time

### Summary
  * Traditional call centers face mounting costs from staffing, infrastructure, and operational expenses, while AI solutions offer potential long-term savings
  * The transition from human agents to artificial intelligence (AI)-powered call centers can reduce operational costs by 30-70%, depending on implementation
  * Understanding the complete cost structure of both options is critical for making informed business decisions
  * AI call centers provide 24/7 coverage without overtime expenses and eliminate costs associated with agent turnover
"Hello, how can I help you today?" For decades, this greeting has been delivered by human agents in call centers across the globe. But increasingly, these same words are being [spoken by AI voices](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/use-ai-in-customer-support) nearly indistinguishable from their human counterparts. 
The shift isn't just about technological advancement â€” it's about the bottom line.
Traditional call centers are becoming increasingly expensive. Rising labor costs, physical infrastructure expenses, and high employee turnover rates have pushed operational costs to unsustainable levels for many businesses. Meanwhile, [Conversational AI](https://elevenlabs.io/conversational-ai#ai-agents) call center technology has matured rapidly, making it high-quality but comparatively low-cost. 
This article compares just how much each approach costs, helping you work out which is right for your business.
## The true cost of traditional call centers
Traditional call centers have formed the backbone of [customer support](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/customer-support-with-conversational-ai-and-text-to-speech) for decades. However, their cost structure is increasingly challenging for businesses to sustain. Here's why:
  * **Labor costs:** These account for 60-70% of total expenditure. A modest four-person in-house call center 
  * **Turnover expenses:** Call centers face turnover rates of 30-45% annually. Each departing agent represents $10,000-$20,000 in lost investment and replacement costs, creating a costly cycle of continuous hiring and training.
  * **Infrastructure requirements:** Physical space ($25-$50 per square foot annually), equipment ($1,500-$3,000 per workstation), telecommunication systems ($700-$1,000 per user), and ongoing utilities all contribute to substantial overhead costs.
  * **Scaling challenges:** Traditional centers must staff for peak volumes, resulting in costly idle time during slower periods. Offering 24/7 service demands premium pay for overnight shifts, while unexpected high call volumes often lead to customer frustration and lost business.
## AI call center cost structure
AI call centers operate on a fundamentally different cost model, shifting expenses from ongoing labor to technology investment and subscription services. This approach creates a more predictable and often more cost-effective financial structure.
  * **Implementation costs:** Initial setup includes AI platform licensing (ranging from $25-$1,320 per month per concurrent channel) and integration with existing systems. According to ElevenLabs' pricing, businesses can start with basic conversational AI capabilities for as little as $5 per month, with enterprise solutions scaling based on volume.
  * **Operational expenses:** AI solutions typically follow subscription-based pricing (per-minute, per-call, or concurrent channel models). These costs increase linearly with usage rather than in large staffing increments, making scaling more predictable and eliminating the need for most physical infrastructure.
  * **Maintenance requirements:** While traditional centers have ongoing hiring and training expenses, AI systems primarily require content and knowledge base updates to keep responses current. Software updates are generally included in subscription pricing, significantly reducing ongoing maintenance overhead.
  * **Scalability advantages:** AI systems can handle multiple customer interactions simultaneously and scale instantly during high volume periods without additional costs. This eliminates the staffing inefficiencies inherent in traditional models where capacity must be maintained regardless of demand.
## Direct cost comparison analysis
Traditional call centers typically cost $5-$25 per customer interaction when all expenses are factored in, varying based on call complexity and duration. AI solutions dramatically reduce this figure to $0.50-$5 per interaction, representing potential savings of 70-90%.
This cost difference becomes more pronounced at scale. Traditional centers face step-function increases when expanding. Adding agents requires full salary packages, physical space comes in large increments, and equipment purchases happen in bulk. On the other hand, AI systems scale gradually with minute-based or usage-based pricing allowing for incremental growth without physical expansion.
The contrast is particularly stark for 24/7 coverage. Traditional approaches require night shift premiums (typically 15-30% higher wages), weekend and holiday differentials, and minimum staffing regardless of call volume. AI maintains the same cost structure regardless of time, with no premiums and capacity that adjusts automatically to demand. This translates to investment recovery timelines that differ significantly.
Traditional centers typically require 12-24 months to recoup initial investments with high ongoing costs. Meanwhile, AI implementations often show positive ROI within 3-9 months due to dramatically lower ongoing expenses.
## Case ctudy: Thoughtly's experience with ElevenLabs
"I love Tessa because she never sleeps!"
That's how one sales team member described [Thoughtly's AI agent](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/thoughtly)â€”powered by ElevenLabs' voice technology. Tessa works 24/7. She handles calls in 50 seconds flat. And customers can't tell she's not human.
The partnership began in October 2023 when Thoughtly integrated ElevenLabs' turbo voice model. The results were immediate. Millions of calls automated. Customer wait times slashed. Cost-per-interaction plummeted.
What makes this case study remarkable isn't just efficiencyâ€”it's the emotional connection. Customers develop rapport with these AI agents, completely unaware they're synthetic. One business owner was repeatedly confused when callers asked for "Gabriel." [Throughout 2024](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/how-elevenlabs-is-preparing-for-elections-in-2024), a pivotal election year in countries across the globe, weâ€™ve taken concrete steps designed to prevent the misuse of our tools. In advance of the November 5th U.S. election, hereâ€™s an update on our efforts.
**Policies**
We revised our [Prohibited Use Policy](https://elevenlabs.io/use-policy) to strengthen and clarify our rules regarding the use of our tools in the context of elections.
  * **Ban on campaigning and the impersonation of candidates.** We strictly prohibit the use of our tools for political campaigning, including promoting or advocating for a particular candidate, issue, or position, or soliciting votes or financial contributions. We also prohibit the use of our tools to mimic the voices of political candidates and elected government officials.
  * **Ban on voter suppression and disruptions of the electoral process.** We prohibit the use of our tools to incite, engage in, or facilitate voter suppression or other disruptions of electoral or civic processes. This includes creating, distributing, or facilitating the spread of misleading information.
**Prevention**
Weâ€™ve enhanced our safeguards to prevent the misuse of our tools in the context of elections. 
  * **User screening.** All users of our voice cloning tools must provide contact and payment information, which helps us block accounts linked to fraudulent activity or high-risk geographies at sign-up.

Weâ€™ve continuously expanded this safeguard to increase its effectiveness, and we monitor and take enforcement actions against users who attempt to generate blocked voices.
**Detection and Enforcement**
To complement our preventative measures, weâ€™ve ramped up our detection and enforcement capabilities.
  * **Monitoring for misuse.** Our improved proprietary classifiers, including one specifically designed to identify political content, alongside automated moderation and human reviewers, help us detect content that violates our terms. We also work with external threat intelligence teams that provide insights on potential misuse aimed at disrupting elections, and we have set up information sharing channels with government and industry partners.
  * **Strong enforcement.** When we identify misuse, we take decisive action, including removing voices, placing users on probation, banning users from our platform, and if appropriate, reporting to authorities. If you come across problematic content that you think may have originated from ElevenLabs, please [let us know](https://help.elevenlabs.io/hc/en-us/requests/new?tf_13297797982993=report_content).
  * **Support for government efforts.** We believe that government action is critical to deterring misuse. In July, we were proud to [announce](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/elevenlabs-supports-congressional-efforts-to-advance-ai-safety-and-innovation) our support for the _Protect Elections from Deceptive AI Act,_ bipartisan legislation led by Senators Amy Klobuchar, Josh Hawley, Chris Coons, Susan Collins, Maria Cantwell, Todd Young, John Hickenlooper, and Marsha Blackburn, which would hold accountable bad actors who use AI in campaign ads to deceive voters. Weâ€™ll continue to work with policymakers in the U.S. and across the globe on AI safety initiatives, including those related to elections.
**Provenance and Transparency**
Enabling the clear identification of AI-generated content, including through broad collaboration, remains a key aspect of ElevenLabsâ€™ responsible development efforts.
  * **AI Speech Classifier.** Our [AI Speech Classifier](https://elevenlabs.io/ai-speech-classifier), available to the public since [June 2023](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/ai-speech-classifier), lets anyone upload an audio sample for analysis as to whether it originated from ElevenLabs. By making this tool public, we aim to limit the spread of misinformation by making the source of audio easier to identify.
  * **Collaborating with industry.** When it comes to AI content provenance and transparency, we canâ€™t go it aloneâ€”an industry-wide effort is a necessity.

Last weekend we held the inaugural ElevenLabs Worldwide Hackathon in collaboration with a16z and partners PostHog, Lovable, Clerk, Make, PICA, fal.ai, Vercel and Mistral, bringing together hundreds of developers and builders from all over the world to build more than 
Across six in-person events, three community events, and a global virtual gathering hosted on our Discord server, builders spent 40 hours bringing to life innovative AI agents using ElevenLabs and partner technologies from PostHog, Lovable, Clerk, Make, PICA, fal.ai, Vercel and Mistral.
We were overwhelmed with more than 300 high-quality projects making it incredibly tough for our judges, Mati Staniszewski (CEO ElevenLabs), Guillermo Rauch (CEO Vercel), James Hawkins (CEO of PostHog), Anton Osika (CEO of Lovable), Bryan Kim (Partner at a16z) and Justine Moore (Partner at a16z), to choose the winners.
Without further ado, we're excited to present to you the winning projects of the worldwide hackathon as well as a recap of the six in-person events around the world.

## Online hackathon winners
![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2Frctl6zflqic-Awards%202.webp&w=3840&q=95)
While we of course love hacking together in person, we also wanted to include our global community in the hackathon. So we took to our Discord server to host a virtual chapter of the hackathon. Hundreds of builders from all over the world across all timezones joined in to hack together. It was very wholesome to see everyone collaborating and helping each other out.
Over the past couple of days, our panel of judges comprised of Mati Staniszewski (CEO ElevenLabs), Guillermo Rauch (CEO Vercel), James Hawkins (CEO of PostHog), Anton Osika (CEO of Lovable), Bryan Kim (Partner at a16z) and Justine Moore (Partner at a16z), reviewed your projects and selected the winners.
### 1st Prize - Hugo Tour Guide
Yilun Sun (Product Manager and Designer), Qiang Fang (Backend Engineer), David Chen (Frontend Engineer), Aiden Zhao (AI Engineer), a four person team from California, USA, built an impressively feature rich conversational travel agent providing a personalized, location-aware travel experience.
The team is planning to continue working on the project to turn it into a real product, and the first price, Apple Mac Minis for each team member, will be very helpful for them to bring Hugo to market.
### 2nd Prize - Pep - your compassionate Physical Therapy Agent
Runner up, 
Built by Feng Yan, and Lora Xie, a two person team collaborating across the US and China, is a great example of how we can utilize AI technologies to improve the lives of people around the world. For their efforts, they take home a Teenage Engineering OB-4, portable loudspeaker, the perfect companion to make sure Pep's voice is heard.
### 3rd Prize - Agent SFX
Coming in third, 
Using vision models on fal.ai, the agent analyzes the game's node structure and screenshots and then gets to work generating voiceovers and sound effects that the developer can use in their game. The solution during the hackathon was initially built for the open source 
Built by game developers Arian Allenson Valdez, and Maria Mikhaela Magpoc from the Philippines, the team can look forward to a Shure MV6 microphone each, which should serve them well during their late night gaming sessions.

# Narrating AnyTopic's audiobooks
Jun 21, 2024 â€¢ 3 minutes reading time
ElevenLabs voices educational content
![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2F7kb3nx7ce08-anytopic.webp&w=3840&q=95)![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2F7kb3nx7ce08-anytopic.webp&w=3840&q=95)
Users enter a topic or a question, and the platform finds top-matching online content: news, blogs, existing podcasts, and more. Then, the app creates a mini audiobook from this material, ranging in length from 3 - 25 minutes long.
These customized, bite-size episodes are designed to fit into users' busy lives, perfect for listening during the commute or when winding down in the evening. The app's personalization features tailor each audiobook to the userâ€™s interests and learning pace, providing customized content for each individual.
**Choosing ElevenLabs**
When AnyTopic was starting out, it was focused on finding the most cutting-edge solutions. 
â€œWe were doing research on the most advanced models for voice generation, with the goal of using one of these models to generate personalized [AI audiobooks.](https://elevenlabs.io/use-cases/audiobooks)â€ Sam Wesley, Co-founder & CTO
Of course, an audiobook can't exist without a narrator. But using traditional voiceover artists was out of the question.
They needed an AI voice generator that was non-robotic and expressive. It had to keep users engaged, just like listening to a great teacher. But they also needed software that was going to support high-quality audio. They knew that poor audio quality would make learners far less likely to want to keep listening.
â€œUpon discovering ElevenLabs, which stood out as one of the most human-sounding options, we tested it and were impressed with the quality.â€
Of course, selecting the model was just the first stepâ€”they then needed to integrate it with their app. Thankfully, this was seamless. â€œWe were able to easily incorporate the ElevenLabs voice API as the final step in our established [AI audiobook](https://elevenlabs.io/use-cases/audiobooks) generation pipeline", the team explains.
ElevenLabs real-time latency generates audio content near-instantly, meaning learners can dive into a subject without long waiting times. Plus, the API integration means users can handle everything in one easy-to-use interface, making learning quick and simple on the go.
The app is still in the beta stage of development, but promises great things. 
â€œWeâ€™re excited about the future of personalized contentâ€”particularly in the audio spaceâ€ says Daniel Rascon, Co-founder and CEO of AnyTopic. â€œElevenLabs has been helpful to help us bring this vision to life a lot faster and at the level of quality weâ€™re looking for. Weâ€™re excited to create more engaging audio experiences for our listeners.â€

### Revolutionizing audio content creation
Audio Pitara is a podcast production company with original content in a variety of genres including History, Horror and Romance. This year, they started exploring AI Audio solutions in the hopes of finding something that could help them achieve low production costs and quick turnaround times, while maintaining the depth of narration needed to engage fans. They chose ElevenLabs because of the quality of our Hindi text to speech and are large library of Indian voices. 
### Bringing "Dil se Dil tak" to life
Audio Pitara's flagship project, "Dil se Dil tak," is a daily podcast featuring romantic stories voiced by ElevenLabs. Initially, they kept the AI nature of the voice under wraps, concerned about potential audience reactions.
The results were astounding. Tapan Gupta, Co-Founder of Audio Pitara, shares:
> We asked our friends and people from the voicing industry for their thoughts on the podcast and the narrator's voice. To our delight, everyone loved both the story and the voice, remarking that it sounded like one of us was narrating the story. No one suspected it was an AI voice.

### Global success and recognition
The success of "Dil se Dil tak" speaks volumes about the quality and acceptance of AI-generated voices.
As of July 2024:
  * All-Time Downloads: 428,422
  * Fans in India, United States, Canada, Australia, Singapore, United Arab Emirates, France, and 50+ more countries
  * #1 - Chartable: Podcasts: Global: Fiction: Trending
  * #5 - Chartable: Podcasts: Global: Society & Culture: Trending

### Looking Ahead
Audio Pitara isn't stopping at "Dil se Dil tak." They're using ElevenLabs to voice audiobooks and other audio shows, with plans to expand aggressively into content creation for every age group and ethnicity.
Tapan Gupta elaborates on their vision:
> AI-enabled voice overs and dubbing are set to revolutionize the future of podcasts and audiobooks. With advancements in AI technology, we can achieve low-cost production, faster delivery, and seamless editing, making high-quality audio content more accessible than ever. This transformation not only enhances the listener's experience but also empowers creators to bring their stories to life with unprecedented efficiency and creativity.
As Audio Pitara continues to push the boundaries of what's possible with AI-generated voices, they're setting new standards in the podcasting industry. Weâ€™re proud to see AI Audio make more content accessible for global audiences, now in Hindi and soon every language and voice.

# Auto-regenerate is live in Studio
Nov 19, 2024 â€¢ 3 minutes reading time
Our long form text editor now lets you regenerate faulty fragments, adjust playback speed, and provide quality feedback
![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2F21rrgg1eyy3h-QualityCheckBlogCover.webp&w=3840&q=95)![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2F9k5gnundaaw-Quality%20Check%20Blog%20Cover%201x1.webp&w=3840&q=95)
**Auto regeneration**
Every time you generate audio, we check for mispronunciations and unwanted artifacts. If we find any issues, the system automatically regenerates the audio at no extra cost.
You can enable this feature in two places:
  * In **Settings** while editing a specific chapter:
  * In the **Convert dialogue window** to apply automatic regenerations across an entire project:
**Feedback**
Weâ€™ve also introduced a **thumbs-down feedback button** which lets you flag sub-par audio generations. This feedback helps us refine our internal error detection and improve future results.
**Playback speed**
These updates, along with the ability to playback audio at 2x speed, have reduced the time to needed to quality-check long form content by up to 70% among our beta group.

Ensuring compatibility with existing pipelines and integration with game engines is also crucial. Ultimately, selecting tools aligned with the project's vision and technical needs is paramount for AAA studios aiming for unparalleled audio immersion.

## What are sound effects?
Sound effects, sometimes known as sound FX, are **artificially created or enhanced sounds** used to emphasize or add realism to storytelling in diverse media, for example, movies, television shows, computer games, and theater productions.
[Sound effects](https://elevenlabs.io/sound-effects) are so ubiqitous, you'll probably don't notice them in your favorite movie. They are incredibly diverse and include background noises, the sound of vehicle crashes, the chatter of a crowd, applause, the gentle trickle of a stream - whatever you can think of.
The purpose of this kind of sound in content creation, film-making, and storytelling is to enrich the narrative by providing auditory cues that complement visual images or recordings. They can be realistic (i.e., a real sound of something) or musical (i.e., background music that complements the storyline).
Ultimately, sound has an important role to play in how we humans interpret and understand stories. We all know and recognize the happy jingle of a popular advertisement, the tension from the Jaws background music, or even the inspirational swell of applause, and our bodies and minds react to these sounds in different ways.
As a result, sound FX can enhance your storytelling, delight your audience, and entertain your listeners. They're an important part of professional video and podcast creation and play a critical role in engaging an audience and effectively sharing a narrative.
## The history of sound effect generation
But sound hasn't always been a part of the narrative scene. In fact, in the old movies, sound was unable to be recorded, 
When sound recordings in films became more freely available during the 20th century, realistic sounds in a movie or on the radio started to become important. 
Foley artists used a range of everyday items to create the sounds of events happening on-screen or over the radiowaves. This could include a shoe and a wooden board for creepy footsteps, water bowls for the sound of splashing, and balloons popping for the sound of gunshots. This type of sound effect creation required precise human interaction and creativity, a silent audio recording studio, and expert equipment.
During the 21st century, sound effects have become ubiquitous and are expected in every type of film, movie, video content, advertisement, and even podcast. A modern movie audience is unlikely to watch a movie in silence, and grandiose sound effects, even on YouTube videos and in TikTik shorts, are increasingly common.
Research has given movie-makers and content creators the power to use sound effects for psychological purposes and an immersive experience, for instance, with background sounds that are unsettling to the listener or sounds that lull us into a false sense of security. [Sound effects](https://elevenlabs.io/sound-effects) can even be used to move action on, close the screen, show an audience when to laugh or cry, and even be the punchline to a joke.
Although Foley artists still exist for big-budget productions, sound effects can be bought from a sound FX library or generated using AI technology. The reduced costs and wide availability of sound FX means that even amateur content can make use of professional effects and realistic noises to add the next level of immersion and entertainment to their content.
## Can AI generate sound effects?
So, can AI really generate realistic, widely available, and unique sound effects? The answer is  _yes_.
Generative AI has taken the world by storm in the past few years, resulting in incredible breakthroughs in softwares that produce incredible visual image generation, text generation, and even [voice generation](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/what-is-text-to-speech/). Audio sounds and music, however, have been a little harder.
This is because AI struggled to comprehend the variety of noise. Ideas of melody, rhythm, genres, and creativity are difficult for computer models to replicate, which has held AI audio generation back in comparison to large-language models such as ChatGPT.
But 2023 marked a breakthrough, with hyper-realistic voice cloning software like [ElevenLabs](https://elevenlabs.io/text-to-speech) bursting onto the scene, bringing easy-to-use software that generates voice, sound, and speech with incredible degrees of accuracy. Not to be one left behind by a technological innovation, Meta announced in August 2023 the release and emergence of AudioCraft, a free generative AI tool for music generation and sound effects. AudioCraft features three distinct models, each with a specific function:
**MusicGen:** By using music owned by Meta or specifically licensed, MusicGen transforms text prompts into musical pieces. Input just a few lines of text, and MusicGen can generate a full composition.
**AudioGen:** Trained on a wide range of publicly available sound effects, AudioGen is capable of generating realistic sounds from text descriptions, such as the whistle of the wind or the sound of knocking on a wooden door.
**EnCodec:** This model represents the latest advancement in decoding technology, with cutting-edge, new features that allow for the generation of high-quality music in a range of HZ with reduced artifacts.
Collectively, the three AI models in AudioCraft provide creators with the tools to play with new musical compositions, enhance videos with soundtracks and sound FX, and create new pieces of audio from text. The problem with AudioCraft? It's not very easy to install, run, or use. But what are [conversational AI agents](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/all-about-conversational-ai-agents) at their core?
Without delving into highly technical definitions, conversational AI agents can be considered ultra-sophisticated versions of ordinary chatbots or virtual assistants. 
While your standardized chatbot or assistant can respond to basic questions or requests, conversational AI agents go above and beyond to understand your intent and process natural language to provide human-like responses or take specific actions. 
Although conversational AI is not a new technology per se, itâ€™s certainly advanced over the last few years alongside overall developments in artificial intelligence, leading to AI agents becoming increasingly more human-like and intelligent. 
## Applications of conversational AI agents 
When we said conversational AI agents are everywhere, we werenâ€™t exaggerating. As artificial intelligence continues to advance, the capabilities of AI agents also grow and diversify. 
That said, letâ€™s take a closer look at some widespread use cases of conversational AI: 
### Customer support 
While the traditional customer service bot is not well-equipped to handle questions or complaints beyond the bare minimum, conversational AI agents can understand the intent behind specific queries and respond accordingly. 
Conversational AI can help large companies and small businesses streamline their customer support processes without hiring a whole team of agents to handle complaints. If a case is too complex to solve, the agent can simply pass the ticket to a human agent and continue working on incoming tickets as required. 
To personalize AI-powered customer support even further, companies can integrate natural-sounding [text to speech software](https://elevenlabs.io/conversational-ai) into their customer support applications for a completely authentic experience. 
### eCommerce and retail
Conversational AI agents can act as personalized shopping assistants, helping customers with product searches and providing product recommendations. They are quick to figure out individual preferences, analyzing each interaction and click to provide shoppers with personalized shopping experiences based on the information gathered and processed. 
AI agents can also perform routine tasks like managing orders, modifying purchases, initiating returns, reminding customers about abandoned shopping carts, and other tasks usually left to customer service representatives. You can even implement conversational AI to encourage customers to participate in seasonal offers or make the most of sales and discounts. 
### Healthcare
You may be surprised to learn that conversational AI is also being implemented in healthcare as we speak. 
Conversational AI agents can perform a wide range of tasks in the health and wellness sphere, including helping patients schedule appointments, answering questions related to medications or treatments, and even helping patients figure out their symptoms and suggest the best course of action. 
Depending on the level of sophistication, some agents can also provide mental health support and share useful tips on managing stress and anxiety.
### Banking and finance 
Financial management can be complicated and stressful, especially for customers opening their first bank accounts, taking out their first loan, or dealing with unexpected changes to their online banking systems. 
This is where AI agents can assist with all sorts of tasks, from basic requests like checking a balance to more complex processes like guiding a customer through the stages of applying for a loan. 
In addition, conversational AI is well-equipped to detect unusual activity, alert customers in real-time, and suggest the best course of action. 
### Human resources and recruitment
Conversational AI agents can assist businesses in more ways than one, with HR and recruitment being a key sphere in which they excel. From candidate screening to employee onboarding, conversational AI can assist with day-to-day HR management processes and interact with employees on behalf of HR agents. They can also answer common questions regarding employee benefits, vacation time, and payroll information. 
These assistive capabilities allow the HR team to focus on the larger picture, including fostering a healthy work environment and developing valuable policies for employees and the company. 
### Travel and hospitality
Working in travel and hospitality is not easy, given how many things can go wrongâ€”canceled flights, hotel booking mishaps, and other common errors. To make things easier for service workers and travelers, conversational AI agents can be implemented to assist with routine tasks like booking and reservation assistance while also helping customers by providing real-time flight and accommodation information. 
In addition, hotels can use conversational AI in the form of chatbots or voice assistants to provide travelers with helpful information regarding room service, hotel policies, taxi services, and even local attractions. 
### Education 
From personalized tutoring sessions to administrative support, conversational AI agents are being actively implemented in education and e-learning as we speak. Virtual learning assistants and AI tutors can help students catch up on homework or improve in certain subjects, preventing them from falling behind. Likewise, AI agents can also perform routine administrative tasks like assisting students in registering for courses, tracking assignments, and managing schedules. 
The result? Students are better supported, and teachers can refine their skills and focus on providing the best learning experience.
### Gaming and entertainment 
One sphere of conversational AI that has massive potential is undoubtedly entertainment. Not only can AI agents be used to make personalized recommendations to viewers and content consumers, but they can also make gaming experiences more interactive.
Conversational AI can be integrated into video games to create interactive characters, ranging from NPCs (non-playable characters) with intelligent dialogue to AI-driven game masters in role-playing games. 
Game developers can further enhance gameplay by integrating [natural-sounding text to speech tools](https://elevenlabs.io/use-cases/gaming), making characters sound increasingly more human-like as time progresses. However, itâ€™s essential to choose a text to speech tool with realistic output like ElevenLabs; otherwise, your characters will end up sounding artificial and robotic. 
## Final thoughts 
Weâ€™re only beginning to uncover conversational AI's full potential, yet itâ€™s already reshaping the way we work, travel, interact with others, complete routine tasks, and spend our time off. 
Conversational AI agents are becoming increasingly present in all spheres of our lives, including customer service and support, eCommerce, healthcare, finance, travel, education, and even entertainment. 
Itâ€™s safe to say that, in time, conversational AI agents will be assisting us across most professions and industries. Given how rapidly artificial intelligence is advancing, anything is possible.

# Learning chess aloud
May 24, 2024 â€¢ 3 minutes reading time
Chess.com gives their virtual chess teacher a voice
![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2Fa3okvav9hmq-chess-desktop.jpg&w=3840&q=95)![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2F5nz3p874j5p-ches2.png&w=3840&q=95)
Chess has captivated players around the world for over 1,000 years, a testament to its enduring appeal and strategic depth. Founded in 2007, Chess.com is dedicated to serving this large and dynamic community. The team continually explores new ways for players of all levels to engage with the game, offering innovative tools for playing, connecting, and learning online. 
Last year, a user of one of Chess.com's top learning apps, Learn Chess with Dr. Wolf, left a review: "Is there a way to get Dr. Wolf to talk through the lessons? My 7-year-old is struggling to read his commentary." Dr. Wolf, an interactive virtual chess teacher, adapts to the user's ability and helps them improve by talking through each move.
At the time, Dr. Wolf only provided text commentary without an audio component. The team recognized the potential to greatly improve the learning experience with a voice, but they knew the wrong audio component would severely detract from the learning experience. 
**Partnering with ElevenLabs**
Finding the right voice for Dr. Wolf was crucial to connect with a wide range of players and skill levels. It required finding a voice that was both authoritative and warm to maintain the personal touch of a seasoned chess coach. After sampling several voices from ElevenLabs' library, the team found one that was just what they needed. Soon after, they integrated the voice using ElevenLabs' API.
The response from users has been overwhelmingly positive. They have noted that the ideas seem to sink in more when they're able to keep their eyes actively engaged on the chessboard, and the game feels much more natural when all you have to do is listen. 
â€œThe introduction of a voice for Dr. Wolf has transformed our appâ€, said Gabe Jacobs, the product manager on the Dr. Wolf team. â€œIt's not just a featureâ€”itâ€™s brought a whole new dimension to learning chess online.â€ 
By bringing together educational expertise and ElevenLabsâ€™ technology, the Dr. Wolf team found a new way to provide personalized, engaging 1:1 chess tutoring to players around the world. We look forward to continuing our work and exploring new ways to inspire and educate chess enthusiasts around the world.

Our all in one platform for building customizable, interactive voice agents
![Conversational AI SEO Image](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2Fs1hrjw6jw6-Conv%20AI%20Blog%20Cover.webp&w=3840&q=95)![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2F4u9rqlo8z4l-Cover%20\(1\).webp&w=3840&q=95)
Today we're proud to introduce [Conversational AI](https://elevenlabs.io/conversational-ai) - our all in one platform for building customizable, interactive voice agents. With Conversational AI, you can create outbound sales dialers, scheduling agents, interactive game characters, tutors, customer support agents, and more.
Our platform is designed for low latency, thanks to fewer server calls. Conversational AI handles turn-taking and interruptions gracefully using a real-time model to predict when a speaker is finished. Weâ€™ve also simplified the technical setup so you can focus on customizing your agent.
Conversational AI connects our life-like Text to Speech, Speech to Text, an LLM of your choice, with our custom turn-taking and interruption logic that makes conversation feel natural. This leaves you to focus on:
  * Building your knowledge base
  * Crafting your system prompt
  * Connecting your apps with function calling
  * Selecting your favorite voice from our library or cloning your own
  * Finding ways to use Conversational AI to delight your customers with unbelievable experiences
Conversational AI includes advanced features to help you build more interactive agents, including:
  * Native Twilio integration for handling calls
  * Server-side and client-side tool calling for added flexibility
  * Dynamic prompting to create personalized conversations
Hereâ€™s our overview on how to [configure your first agent](https://elevenlabs.io/docs/conversational-ai/docs/agent-setup). If you prefer complete control, you can connect your own LLM or server with [this guide](https://elevenlabs.io/docs/conversational-ai/customization/byollm). We have a [Python, Javascript, React and Swift SDK](https://elevenlabs.io/docs/conversational-ai/libraries/conversational-ai-sdk-python), or you can integrate with the [WebSocket API](https://elevenlabs.io/docs/conversational-ai/api-reference/websocket) directly. 
You can see an example project built using our SDK [here](https://elevenlabs.io/docs/conversational-ai/guides/conversational-ai-guide).

In 1988, Benjamin Bloom, an educational psychologist at the University of Chicago, wrote an essay purporting tutorials as "the best learning conditions we can devise." Tutors, Bloom claimed, could raise student achievement by two full standard deviationsâ€”or, in statistical parlance, two "sigmas"â€”essentially going from the 50th percentile to the 98th. 
For forty years, education technology has chased a seemingly impossible goal: matching the effectiveness of one-on-one tutoring at scale. While the potential impact was clear, the economics never worked, until now.
While human tutors typically cost $30-50 per hour, [Conversational AI](https://elevenlabs.io/conversational-ai) solutions can deliver comparable outcomes at $3-5, a 90% lower cost. This order of magnitude cost reduction represents the potential to transform personalized education from a luxury good into reach for the mass-market.
But the most profound insights aren't about cost savingsâ€”they're about how voice is revealing counterintuitive truths about focus, engagement, and assessment that could reshape education entirely. Early implementations by companies like 
## Uninterrupted focus: how voice enables deeper immersion
When Chess.com [added](https://elevenlabs.io/blog/chess-dot-com) a voice to their Dr. Wolf instructor, they expected the primary benefit would be accessibility. Instead, they discovered that voice enabled a fundamentally deeper level of focus for learners.
With voice guidance, students could keep their eyes locked on the board and their fingers on the pieces, fully immersing themselves in the spatial and strategic dimensions of the game. "Voice is not just a featureâ€”it's brought a whole new dimension to learning chess online," explains Gabe Jacobs, the product manager for Dr. Wolf. 
By freeing students from the need to constantly shift their visual attention, voice allowed them to stay in a state of uninterrupted concentration. With work underway to add conversational ability to the app, it's a new age for the game of kings.
The need for students to split visual focus may be a hidden tax on digital learningâ€”one that voice can eliminate. When students can stay visually focused on the primary learning material, whether chessboard or calculus, they can engage more deeply and grasp concepts more intuitively. 
Voice becomes a way to maintain immersion while still receiving guidance, enabling a kind of ambient support that enhances understanding rather than disrupting it.
## Interruptibility: turning passive consumption into active inquiry
Coursology's experience takes this insight even further, showing how interruption, when implemented intentionally, can transform learning. Coursology, which started as an AI homework helper, grew from zero to 50,000 users in its first month by helping students understand course materials more effectively. With its newest feature, Coursology users can interrupt AI-generated podcasts with questions, turning passive content consumption into active exploration.
"The aha moment is when students realize they can upload their most impenetrable course materials and engage in a dialogue with speakers who know everything about those topics," explains founder Colby Schmidt. Rather than breaking focus, the ability to spontaneously interrogate the material enables students to learn more deeply and efficiently.
This feature reveals a counterintuitive truth about engagement: the ability to interrupt without losing momentum may be more important than delivering flawless, linear content. The natural back-and-forth of questions and answers keeps students engaged with the material itself, not just plodding along a predetermined lesson plan.
At one-tenth the cost of human tutoring, AI allows this kind of dynamic interaction to be scaled to millions of students. The implications are profound: with tools like Coursology, the availability of on-demand personalized tutoring will grow by an order of magnitude in the coming years. Coursology itself is about to tip one million users.
## Assessment: from teaching to insight generation
SchoolAI's evolution reveals yet another unexpected opportunity. One feature allows students to learn through conversation: high school history students can speak with figures like Abraham Lincoln or Amelia Earhart, for example. What started as a platform for interactive conversations evolved into something more fundamental: a powerful tool for understanding how learning happens.
By capturing data on where students struggle, what helps them break through, and how their understanding develops, SchoolAI gives teachers unprecedented visibility into their students' learning journeys. "We're not replacing teachersâ€”we're giving them Ironman suits," explains CTO Cahlan Sharp. "We're saving them over 10 hours a week on assessment, so they can focus on actually teaching."
![SchoolAI Cleopatra](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2Fbrurub7w0v-cleopatra_schoolai.webp&w=3840&q=95)
This points to perhaps the most exciting potential of voice AI in education: the ability to surface actionable insights about the learning process itself. Every voice interaction becomes a data point, illuminating patterns and interventions that would be impossible to discern at scale otherwise. In this sense, the real value of AI may lie not in the teaching, but in the metaknowledge it generates about teaching.
## What these patterns tell us about learning
These early implementations don't just suggest incremental improvementsâ€”they reveal fundamental truths about how people learn. Each discovery challenges our basic assumptions about education.
First, visual attention is more precious than we imagined. Traditional digital learning often forces students to context-switch between reading instructions, watching demonstrations, and practicing skills. This isn't just inconvenientâ€”it's cognitively expensive. Voice liberates visual attention, allowing students to focus entirely on understanding what's in front of them.
Second, the ability to interrupt without losing context might be more important than perfect instruction. The natural flow of questions and answers maintains engagement better than even the most polished linear content. At one-tenth the cost of human tutoring, companies can now scale this kind of dynamic interaction to millions of students.
Third, the real value of AI in education might not be in the teaching itself, but in what it reveals about how learning happens. Every interaction creates data about where students struggle, what helps them break through, and how understanding develops. SchoolAI's evolution shows how this insight alone can transform educationâ€”giving teachers unprecedented visibility into their students' learning journeys.
## From insights to the future of learning
For builders exploring conversational AI, these early signals suggest opportunities to not just optimize existing educational practices, but to reimagine them entirely:
  1. Rethinking immersion: Rather than treating voice as just another interface, consider how it could enable deeper, more focused engagement with primary learning materials. How might you design experiences that capitalize on the full visual immersion that voice allows?
  2. Designing for interruption: Instead of trying to perfect content delivery, consider how you might facilitate more natural, inquisitive interaction. How could you enable students to steer their own learning, to follow their curiosity without breaking momentum?
  3. Capturing metaknowledge: Look for opportunities to surface insights not just about what students are learning, but how they're learning. How might you leverage voice data to illuminate the structures of cognition and comprehension?
The shift that voice represents in education may be as profound as the transition from scheduled broadcast to on-demand streaming in entertainment. Just as platforms like Netflix enabled fundamentally new kinds of storytelling, conversational AI could enable entirely new modes of learning. "The shift in education over the next decade will be from memorizing things to actually retaining knowledge," notes Schmidt. This isn't just speculationâ€”it's already happening.
When Chess.com lets students maintain complete visual focus on the board, when Coursology enables interruption without disruption, when SchoolAI gives teachers unprecedented insight into how their students learnâ€”these aren't just features. They're early signals of how voice AI could reshape education entirely.
![Conversational Voice AI 2024 Chart](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2Fh9ep5otgzgw-ConversationalVoiceAI2024.webp&w=3840&q=95)
In our own data, weâ€™ve seen EdTech lead the charge in conversational AI usage since February 2024. Alongside sales and support, EdTech use cases continue to appear, complementing existing features and inspiring new ones.
For product teams, this represents more than just a feature opportunity. It's a chance to fundamentally rethink how technology can enhance learning. The economics tell one story: AI tutoring at one-tenth the cost means personalized learning could finally reach everyone. But the more profound opportunity lies in what these early implementations reveal: that conversational AI might be the key to unlocking deeper understanding. 
The companies that will define this era will be those that see voice not just as a medium for delivering content, but as an unprecedented window into how we learnâ€”insights that will shape the lives and livelihoods of generations to come.

## Making AI education accessible and engaging

Whether it be the crash of thunder, the soft patter of rain, or a 'HA!' from a virtual audience, [sound effects ](https://elevenlabs.io/sound-effects)have become a staple of content creator videos. Adding a new level of entertainment and creativity, you can't scroll for more than five minutes without hearing the signature Ru Paul's Drag Race 'rattlesnake' drama noise or 'bruh' from the iconic Vine of the same name.
While many of the most popular sound effects have their roots in popular culture (like movies and TV) as well as meme culture and gaming, other sound effects might go unnoticed. That atmospheric weather sound, the sound of applauseâ€”all are so ubiquitous that they've become simply a part of our video landscape.
If you're a creator looking to take the next step in your video creation, using sound effects is a fantastic way to do so. While you could, of course, purchase expensive sound effects from a music library or harness the use of royalty-free templates, the best way to enjoy sound effects is by using the magic of AI.
A great AI sound effect generator will create unique sounds from text prompts with just the click of a button, adding the next level to your videos and turning them from amateur pieces to excellently-produced pieces of content. In this blog, we'll dive into what sound effects are used for in media content and how to create them for yourself using the latest AI tools.
## What are sound effects used for?
[Sound effects ](https://elevenlabs.io/sound-effects)improve the overall quality of your video or audio by adding interesting and quirky nuances to an otherwise one-note affair. Think applause following a particularly salient point or the side-splitting sound of laughter after an excellent joke. 
You could even add in a drum roll, a scream, or a horror-inducing beat. Whatever it is, with generative AI, you can create and develop sounds that convey exactly what you need to create the next viral sensation. But what is the purpose of spending time adding these effects?
### Expressing emotion
Firstly, AI-generated sounds help you express happiness, disbelief, hilarity, or even fear with your audio or video â€“ there's a sound effect for every conceivable emotion. Describe the moment in greater oral detail and encourage the emotion you want your viewers or listeners to feel with the right sound effect (such as a raucous round of applause). 
Is something super cute happening on screen, like otters holding hands? An emphatic "aww" would work well here. How about a sad scene in an animation? Perhaps a light melody would suit.
The reactive sound effects don't always have to be positive, either. Express shock and horror with sounds like a door slamming or opening to build suspense or even creepy noises like creaking and nails on a chalkboard to immerse your audience.
### Reacting with flair
Another powerful use of sound effects is to dramatize a reaction to an event on screen. Adding a sound effect as a funny aside to your narration will add impact to a particularly great clip. 
Emphasize your message and enhance the audio for your audience, whether that message is "this is the funniest thing you've ever seen and I want to drive that home with the best sound effect I can find" or "this is how I'd like the audience to react, so I'm going to insert the relevant sound effect to encourage them to feel a certain way."
Ultimately, sound effects can heighten your audience's reaction to what they see before them. Cracking a joke or introducing a sad, emotive moment can be signaled with the correct sound.
### Explore sound effects as editing tools
Beyond the usual, side effects can also be used to help your viewer follow the narration.
One way of doing this is by using sounds to split up clips or as a sign of moving on to the next part. For example, a sound effect that includes speech, such as "and now for something completely different" (referencing comedy geniuses Monty Python) could be applied along with extra background sound effects to make it your own. 
Other creators make use of a 'swish' sound when their scene changes location or another form of sound to indicate that a scene is coming to an end. In this way, the sound effect acts as a subtle guide for your audience to follow the plot.
### Creativity with no limits
Sound effects aren't just for vlogs or reaction videos; they have plenty of other creative uses too. 
Musicians have always found inspiration in everyday noises for their music - just look at Pink Floyd! 
Take inspiration from the music greats and include your own sound effects to emphasize a point, create a beat, create a unique soundtrack, or more.
## How to create AI sound effects
Traditionally, sound FX would be made by a Foley artist or sound designers using physical tools such as sticks, pinecones, car doors, and more to create the sounds of cracking knuckles, flapping wings, and more. 
These days, Foley artists still play a huge part in post-production for films, but for YouTubers, social media content creators, and more, AI has become the go-to for sound effects.
Foley actors, while pioneers of film, music, and stage, are often expensive. Each actor requires a large day fee, and the best sound is always recorded in a state-of-the-art recording studio â€” another expensive addition. 
AI sound effects, on the other hand, can be generated for low costs and in record time. The best AI sound effect generators only need a few seconds to generate precisely the effect you had in mind and can even be created from a short text prompt. This makes AI sound effects the best choice for YouTubers, TikTok creators, small businesses, and more.

# Introducing Eleven Multilingual v1: Our New Speech Synthesis Model
Apr 27, 2023 â€¢ 5 minutes reading time
Our current deep learning approach leverages more data, more computational power, and novel techniques to deliver our most advanced speech synthesis model
![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2Fk9vproy2lt-Introducing%20Eleven%20Multilingual%20v1_%20Our%20New%20Speech%20Synthesis%20Model.webp&w=3840&q=95)![](https://elevenlabs.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Feleven-public-cdn.elevenlabs.io%2Fpayloadcms%2Fk9vproy2lt-Introducing%20Eleven%20Multilingual%20v1_%20Our%20New%20Speech%20Synthesis%20Model.webp&w=3840&q=95)
On this page
  * [](https://elevenlabs.io/)
  * [Research Overview](https://elevenlabs.io/#4-research-overview)
  * [Democratization of voice](https://elevenlabs.io/#4-democratization-of-voice)
Today, weâ€™re thrilled to launch Eleven Multilingual v1 - our advanced speech synthesis model supporting seven new languages: **French** , **German** , **Hindi** , **Italian** , **Polish** , **Portuguese,** and **Spanish**. Building on top of the research that powered Eleven Monolingual v1, our current deep learning approach leverages more data, more computational power, and novel techniques inside an increasingly sophisticated model, capable of understanding textual nuances and delivering an emotionally rich performance. This advancement expands the creative horizons for creators, game developers, and publishers, and it paves the way for using generative media to create more localized, accessible, and imaginative content.
The new model is available across all subscription plans and you can try it out now on our Beta platform.
[ElevenLabs](https://elevenlabs.io/)
To use it, simply select it from the newly-added drop-down menu within the Speech Synthesis panel.
### Research Overview
Similarly to its predecessor, the new model is based entirely on our in-house research. It retains all the strengths that made **Eleven Monolingual v1** an excellent storytelling tool, such as the ability to adjust delivery based on context and to convey intent and emotions hyper-realistically. These features have now been expanded to newly supported languages through multilingual data training.
A noteworthy feature of the model is its capacity to identify multilingual text and articulate it appropriately. You can now **generate speech in multiple languages using a single prompt** while maintaining each speaker's unique voice characteristics. For the best results, we recommend providing a single language prompt. Although the model can already perform reasonably well with multiple languages at once, further enhancements are needed.
**The new model is compatible with other VoiceLab** features i.e. Instant Voice Cloning and Voice Design. All created voices are expected to maintain most of their original speech characteristics across all languages, including their original accent.
**This being said, the model has known limitations** : numbers, acronyms, and foreign words sometimes default to English when prompted in a different language. For instance, the number "11", or the word â€œradioâ€, typed in a Spanish prompt may be pronounced as they would be in English. We recommend spelling out acronyms and numbers in the target language as we work on improvements.
### Democratization of voice
ElevenLabs was started with the dream of making all content universally accessible in any language and in any voice. Our team members come from all across Europe, Asia and the US. As our team and the world become increasingly multilingual, weâ€™re ever more united behind the vision of making human-quality AI voices available in every language.
The latest iteration of our [Text-to-Speech (TTS)](https://elevenlabs.io/text-to-speech) model is just the initial stepping stone on our path to making this vision a reality. With the advent of human-quality AI voices, users and businesses can now craft and customize audio content according to their needs, priorities and preferences. This has already shown the potential to level the playing field for creators, small businesses, and independent artists. By harnessing the power of AI audio, users can now develop high-quality auditory experiences that rival those produced by larger organizations with more resources.
Those benefits now extend to multilingual, multicultural and educational applications by empowering users, companies, and institutions to produce authentic audio that resonates with a broader audience. By providing an extensive range of voices, accents, and languages, AI helps bridge cultural gaps and promotes global understanding. At Eleven, we believe this newfound accessibility ultimately fosters greater creativity, innovation, and diversity.
**Content creators** who seek to engage with diverse audiences
**Game developers** and **publishers** can create immersive, localized experiences for international audiences, transcending language barriers and connecting with players and listeners to maximize engagement and efficiency, at no loss to quality or accuracy.
**Educational institutions** now have the means to produce audio content for various users in their target languages, bolstering language comprehension and even pronunciation skills, as well as catering to different teaching styles and learning needs.
**Accessibility institutes** can now further empower people with visual impairments or learning difficulties by providing them with means to easily convert less accessible resources to a medium that suits their needs, both in content and form.
We canâ€™t wait to see our current and future creators and developers push the limits of whatâ€™s possible!
